cdoorin2@nrose.name: CDoorIn2
cdoorin2@nrose.examine: What wise words wouldn't this door be able to tell you if it could talk?

cdoorout2@nrose.name: CDoorOut2
cdoorout2@nrose.examine:
As you examine the door, you think you can hear the soft scratching of 
feathered quills against parchment.

cleaver@nrose.name: cleaver
cleaver@nrose.examine: I wouldn't want to be on the receiving end of this thing!
cleaver@nrose.desc[0]: A bloody cleaver has been misplaced here.

bdoorout@nrose.name: BDoorOut
bdoorout@nrose.examine: The door is made of thick planks. There is no keyhole at this side.
bdoorout@nrose.desc[0]: The door has been left open.

book2@nrose.name: book2
book2@nrose.desc[0]: A valuable book in Greek has been carelessly left here.

towel@nrose.name: towel
towel@nrose.examine: Never go anywhere in the universe without a towel.
towel@nrose.desc[0]: A thirsty towel is sitting in a wad on the floor.

whip@nrose.name: whip
whip@nrose.examine:
You should use this regularly to beat the devil out of your wicked
and sinful flesh.
whip@nrose.desc[0]: A bloody leather whip has been left here.

wine@nrose.name: wine
wine@nrose.examine: It smells like vinegar.  Must be French wine.
wine@nrose.desc[0]: A sack of communion wine sits on the floor.

book3@nrose.name: book3
book3@nrose.examine:
It is titled 'The Secrets of Abermud.'  It reads:
'There are many secrets to aid a player in earning quick wizardom.
Killing mobiles seems to be the fastest way to earn points.  But
there are other tricks like....'  The books ends here because
someone has torn out the rest of the important pages.  The torn edges
appear rather blackened like a lightning bolt tore them out.  However,
there is a treatise on the merits of having a one time only
grasshopper versus a multi-use one.  But it is very dry reading.
book3@nrose.desc[0]: A slim leather-bound book is sitting here.

habit2@nrose.name: habit2
habit2@nrose.examine: As you examine it you notice that the fabric seems to be finely woven steel.
habit2@nrose.desc[0]: A very thick robe lies in a heap on the floor.

jar1@nrose.desc[1]: A glass jar filled with a clear liquid stands on a shelf.
jar1@nrose.name: jar1
jar1@nrose.examine: The contents of the jar smell like some kind of hard liquor.
jar1@nrose.desc[0]: A glass jar filled with a clear liquid lies here.

book1@nrose.name: book1
book1@nrose.examine:
The book is written in Latin and appears to describe many powerful herbal
potions and magical spells...  How unfortunate that you never learned
Latin, amice.
book1@nrose.desc[0]: A large, leather-bound book sit here waiting for you to read it.

spectacles@nrose.name: spectacles
spectacles@nrose.examine:
They appear to be reading glasses.  Maybe you should wear them so you can
see where you're going.
spectacles@nrose.desc[0]: A pair of crudely made eye glasses have been dropped here.

rope@nrose.name: rope
rope@nrose.examine:
The rope looks old and rotten.  Would you take a chance on it holding your
weight?

onion@nrose.name: onion
onion@nrose.examine: An onion is a natural aphrodisiac.  Eat it with someone you love.
onion@nrose.desc[0]: An onion is here, giving off a very pleasant oniony smell.

incenser@nrose.name: incenser
incenser@nrose.examine:
It is a little ball with a hole on its top which contains incense which
is burned.  However, for some reason, it is not lit.
incenser@nrose.desc[0]: A small incenser has been dropped here.

bdoorin@nrose.name: BDoorIn
bdoorin@nrose.desc[0]: The door has been left open.

iron@nrose.name: iron
iron@nrose.examine: It's a big branding iron.  And it's very hot on one end!
iron@nrose.desc[0]: A red-hot branding iron is glowing here.

bar@nrose.desc[1]: The bar does not allow the door to be opened.
bar@nrose.name: bar
bar@nrose.examine: The bar appears to be used to lock and unlock the door.
bar@nrose.desc[0]: The bar has been moved aside allowing the door to be opened.

portcullin@nrose.name: PortcullIn
portcullin@nrose.examine:
It's a gate that can be raised and lowered.  I wouldn't want to be under it 
when it comes down.

parchment@nrose.name: parchment
parchment@nrose.desc[0]: A neatly folded piece of parchment is sitting here.

chudoorsout@nrose.desc[1]: The large church doors are closed.
chudoorsout@nrose.name: ChuDoorsOut
chudoorsout@nrose.examine:
The doors have no handles or grips to allow you to open them.
Perhaps there is another way?
chudoorsout@nrose.desc[0]: The large doors to the church stand wide open.

wheel@nrose.name: Wheel
wheel@nrose.examine: It appears to let you open and close the portcullis.
wheel@nrose.desc[0]: A wheel with ropes tied around it is attached to the wall.

portcullout@nrose.name: PortcullOut
portcullout@nrose.examine:
It's a gate that can be raised and lowered.  I wouldn't want to be under it 
when it comes down.

cdoorout1@nrose.name: CDoorOut1
cdoorout1@nrose.examine: Wonder what the monks do behind these doors when the light has gone out?

cdoorin3@nrose.name: CDoorIn3
cdoorin3@nrose.examine: The door is thick and sturdy. It has been designed to keep the world outside.

axe@nrose.name: axe
axe@nrose.examine: You cut your finger as you examine its very sharp blade.
axe@nrose.desc[0]: A very sharp axe has been left here.

manure@nrose.name: manure
manure@nrose.examine:
Oh, dear!  It's pretty potent smelling stuff.  But it appears to be
dry enough to burn.
manure@nrose.desc[0]: Some smelly pig's manure has been trod upon.

cdoorin1@nrose.name: CDoorIn1
cdoorin1@nrose.examine: Small drops of something that looks like blood spots this door.

chudoorsin@nrose.desc[1]: The large church doors are closed.
chudoorsin@nrose.name: ChuDoorsIn
chudoorsin@nrose.examine: The doors have no handles or grips to allow you open them.
chudoorsin@nrose.desc[0]: The large church doors stand wide open.

grain@nrose.name: grain
grain@nrose.examine: It's a big burlap sack full of something that looks like some sort of grain.
grain@nrose.desc[0]: A bag of grain sits against the wall.

sign@nrose.name: sign
sign@nrose.examine:
! ! ! WARNING ! ! !
Ahead of you is a monastery filled with mostly peaceful and good but some
easily irritated and downright wicked monks.  The Gods recommend that you
do not attempt to enter this area until you have over 100 health points.
sign@nrose.desc[0]: A large yellow sign is posted off to one side of the path.

habit1@nrose.name: habit1
habit1@nrose.examine:
It looks like a monk's habit.  Maybe if you wore it you could sneak past
the monks and steal their goodies.
habit1@nrose.desc[0]: A gray, burlap monk's habit has been discarded here.

shelf@nrose.name: shelf
shelf@nrose.examine:
On the shelves are row upon row of different jars.  Pity that the contents
seems so uninteresting.

beet@nrose.desc[1]: A sweet-looking sugar beet was missed by the gardener.
beet@nrose.name: beet
beet@nrose.examine: It looks like a very tasty sugar beet to me.
beet@nrose.desc[0]: Someone has left a sugar beet here!

alouth@nrose.name: alouth
alouth@nrose.examine:
Interesting, out of all the piles and piles of books, this one stood out from
all of them like a sore thumb.  It seems this was spoken by the monks of this
monastery but over time, due to their vows of silence ceased speaking it.
You start reading through it, and find Alouth easy to learn.  Soon, you are
able to converse in it fluently.
alouth@nrose.desc[0]: A volume stands out in this room, which depicts the language of Alouth.

spear@nrose.name: spear
spear@nrose.examine: I hope whoever you skewer with this spear has had his tetanus shots.
spear@nrose.desc[0]: A rusty spear has been left here.

altar@nrose.name: altar
altar@nrose.examine:
It's made of stone.  There appears to be some dirty hand prints on one end
of the altar.
altar@nrose.desc[0]: The altar has been pushed aside opening a passage down.

passage@nrose.name: passage
passage@nrose.desc[0]: A passage leads up to an altar.

rat@nrose.name: rat
rat@nrose.examine: People have been known to eat rats.  Do you dare to?
rat@nrose.desc[0]: A freshly-killed rat has been dropped here.

cdoorout3@nrose.name: CDoorOut3
cdoorout3@nrose.examine:
This door is made of old and thick planks.  It has obviously been designed 
to keep the world outside.

jar2@nrose.desc[1]: On top of one of the shelves stands a small clay jar.
jar2@nrose.name: jar2
jar2@nrose.examine: The contents of the jar smell like bitter almonds.
jar2@nrose.desc[0]: A clay jar filled with a foul-smelling potion has been thrown aside.

bag@nrose.name: bag
bag@nrose.examine: It smells like something dead has been carried in it recently.
bag@nrose.desc[0]: A small bag has been left in a corner.

lamp@nrose.desc[1]: A rather 'sweet' smelling black iron reading lamp is here.
lamp@nrose.name: lamp
lamp@nrose.examine:
It appears to be an antique reading lamp.  However, it doesn't seem to have
burned oil recently.  You see the residue of something more solid in it.
lamp@nrose.desc[2]: A black iron reading lamp is here.
lamp@nrose.desc[0]: A lit iron reading lamp is giving off a horrible smell.

library6@nrose.title: Library
library6@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library14@nrose.title: Library
library14@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library17@nrose.title: Library
library17@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

libsecretroom1@nrose.title: Library Secret Room
libsecretroom1@nrose.description:
The floorboards creak and groan unmercifully with your great
weight and crack shifting the floor.  Struggle as you may, you
lose your balance and fall on the floor.  The shock of your fall
causes the boards to break and you fall through the floor into
the Scriptorium below.  *splat*

pigsties@nrose.title: Pigsties
pigsties@nrose.description:
You are in the monastery pigsties.  The smell in here is
atrocious and as you scan the room you see that you are standing
in the source of the smell.

ossarium2@nrose.title: Ossarium
ossarium2@nrose.description:
You have entered the monastery ossarium.  The room has bones
stacked up everywhere, some in niches dug into the damp walls,
others piled up on the ground.  As you walk around, your feet
slosh through the mud on the floor.  There is a heavy, musty
smell here and you feel strange as if you are walking closer to
your own death.  As you look around you see a stairway up and to
the north is another part of the ossarium.

libsecretroom2@nrose.title: Library Secret Room
libsecretroom2@nrose.description:
You have entered a store room where the librarian keeps the
forbidden and dangerous books.  You are indeed worthy of praise
for having made it to this room.  However, if the inquisition
ever found out you were in here, you would surely die (after
confessing, of course).

cell3@nrose.title: Cell
cell3@nrose.description:
You have entered a monk's cell.  There is a plank bed along one
wall and a table and chair along the opposite wall.  There is a
door to the east.

scriptorium@nrose.title: Scriptorium
scriptorium@nrose.description:
You have entered the monastery scriptorium.  Along one side of
the room are a set of stained-glass windows.  Next to these
windows in neat rows are wooden desks and book stands where the
monks laboriously copy and illuminate books.  Ah, the monastery
must have a library around here somewhere but where can it be?

library2@nrose.title: Library
library2@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

kitchen@nrose.title: Kitchen
kitchen@nrose.description:
You have entered the monastery kitchen.  On one wall is a brick
oven.  The coals in it are hot but nothing is cooking inside it.
Along another wall are some shelves.  As you make a cursory
search of them you don't seem to find anything on them except
dust.

widepath@nrose.title: Wide Path
widepath@nrose.description:
You are on a wide dirt path.  To the north is the tall tower of
the aedificium and to the south you see the smaller monastery
bell tower.

towerbase@nrose.title: Tower Base
towerbase@nrose.description:
You are in the base of the monastery bell tower.  Above you are
several very large bells.  A rope hangs down from the bells
allowing you access up to the bells.  You might be able to climb
up to the top of the tower but it would be a long way down if you
lose your grip and fall.

library13@nrose.title: Library
library13@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library5@nrose.title: Library
library5@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

churchaltar@nrose.title: Church Altar
churchaltar@nrose.description:
You are standing in front of the church altar.  The altar is made
of stone and looks very heavy.  On its front are very frightening
skulls that look so realistic you are afraid to even consider
touching the altar.  To the south is a small doorway.

infirmary@nrose.title: Infirmary
infirmary@nrose.description:
You are in the monastery infirmary.  On the walls are shelves filled
with unlabled clay jars that probably contain odd and exotic herbs,
spices, and potions.  These potions might aid you in your adventures
but they could also be deadly poison.

storehouse@nrose.title: Storehouse
storehouse@nrose.description:
You are in the monastery storehouse where the supplies for the
monks are stored.

library10@nrose.title: Library
library10@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library8@nrose.title: Library
library8@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

librentr@nrose.title: Library Entrance
librentr@nrose.description:
You have found the fabled library of this monastery.  Inside it
are thousands of hand-printed, leather-bound books and ancient
silk-encased scrolls.  In here is incredible knowledge:  the
magic and wisdom of the Arabs, the philosophy and science of the
Greeks, the great histories and poetry of the Romans, and the
forbidden theology of the great heretics.

churchsteps@nrose.title: Church Steps
churchsteps@nrose.description:
You are standing in front of a romanesque church that serves as
the place of worship for the monks.  The steps that lead up to
the doors are covered with dead leaves that are stirred about by
the gusts of the wind.  To the south is the monastery bell tower
and to the north is a much larger tower.

library18@nrose.title: Library
library18@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

cemetery@nrose.title: Cemetery
cemetery@nrose.description:
You are in the monastery cemetery.  There are many graves here,
some of which are quite old.  However, you notice an empty grave.
It seems that someone died recently or the monks are expecting a
death, perhaps that of a visitor?

library20@nrose.title: Library
library20@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

cell2@nrose.title: Cell
cell2@nrose.description:
You have entered a monk's cell.  There is a straw bed along one
wall and a table and chair on the opposite wall.  Unlike the
other cells in this dormitory this one seems to radiate truth,
goodness, and knowledge.  There are scraps of parchment neatly
stacked on the table.  There are feather quills bundled neatly
next to them.  There is a door to the east.

southdorm@nrose.title: Dormitory
southdorm@nrose.description:
You are at the southern end of the hallway of the monk's
dormitory.  There is a door to the west.

widepath2@nrose.title: Wide Path
widepath2@nrose.description:
You are on a wide dirt path which leads from the cemetery to
other buildings in the monastery.  To the north are the pigsties,
to the east are the stables, and to the south is the smithy.

library21@nrose.title: Library
library21@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

church@nrose.title: Church
church@nrose.description:
You have passed through the nave and are now standing at the
transept crossing in the monk's church.  Although it's difficult
to see because the windows don't allow very much light in, there
is enough to see an altar beyond the chancel and inside the
choir.

stables@nrose.title: Stables
stables@nrose.description:
You have entered the monastery stables.  The floor is covered
with filthy hay except in one stall which is very well kept.

smithy@nrose.title: Smithy
smithy@nrose.description:
This is the monastery smithy.  You wonder why you entered this
room because there is very little here of any value except
perhaps for some tools of limited usefulness.

dampstair@nrose.title: Damp Stairway
dampstair@nrose.description:
You are at the base of a very long stairway that leads up into
the aedificium tower.

middorm@nrose.title: Dormitory
middorm@nrose.description:
You are in the hallway of the monk's dormitory which continues to
the north and south.  To the west is a door.

library15@nrose.title: Library
library15@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library1@nrose.title: Library
library1@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

aedificium@nrose.title: Aedificium Steps
aedificium@nrose.description:
You are standing in front of the large tower of the aedificium.
It is known that the scriptorium and the monastery kitchen are
inside this tower but it seems that it is too large for just these
two areas.  You notice a door in the base of the tower to the east.

balneary@nrose.title: Balneary
balneary@nrose.description:
You are in the monk's bath house.  Along one wall are many wooden
tubs with curtains around them that afford the monk's some
privacy when they bathe.  The bath house appears to be clean and
tidy, but you can't help notice a strong musty smell that only
adds to the dreary feeling you get at this monastery.

ossarium@nrose.title: Ossarium
ossarium@nrose.description:
This is the north part of the monastery ossarium. Deep niches
have been dug in the walls to store large piles of skulls and
bones. Bones in neat piles fill the parts of the floor that
isn't covered in mud. A sudden chilly draft makes you jump
and you can feel your heart beat in a faster pace.
A narrow passageway goes up towards the west, and to the south
the ossarium continues.

library12@nrose.title: Library
library12@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library16@nrose.title: Library
library16@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library11@nrose.title: Library
library11@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

library3@nrose.title: Library
library3@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

portcullis@nrose.title: Portcullis
portcullis@nrose.description:
You are beneath an archway which serves as the entrance to what
now appears to be a monastery built inside an old fortress.  A
guard house appears to be built into the walls to the south.

library4@nrose.title: Library
library4@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

gardens@nrose.title: Gardens
gardens@nrose.description:
These are the monk's gardens where they grow some of their
vegetables.  There are more gardens to the east.  To the north
and west are some other buildings.

windpath@nrose.title: Winding Path
windpath@nrose.description:
You are on a winding path which climbs up to what appears from
your position to be a fortress on top of a hill to the east.  To
the north is a small village.  As you approach the structure, you
notice an opening in the walls and move yourself toward it.  The
opening now appears to be an archway with a portcullis.  Chiselled
into the arch are these words, "NOMINE ROSAE", evidently the name
of this place.

library7@nrose.title: Library
library7@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

ingardens@nrose.title: In the Gardens
ingardens@nrose.description:
You are in another part of the gardens.  There once were
vegetables growing here at one time but there is very little left
of use here now.

librarytrap@nrose.title: Library
librarytrap@nrose.description:
You fall thru a trap door and find yourself trapped in a room of
the library.  I hope someone can summon you out.

northdorm@nrose.title: Dormitory
northdorm@nrose.description:
You have just entered the northern end of the hallway of the
monk's dormitory.  There is a door to the west.

library19@nrose.title: Library
library19@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

guardhouse@nrose.title: Guard House
guardhouse@nrose.description:
You are inside a small guard house attached to the archway.  From
the dust, cobwebs, and rotten wood in here you can guess that
this guard house has not been used in a long time.

treepath@nrose.title: Tree-lined Path
treepath@nrose.description:
You are walking down a dirt path lined with dead trees.  To the
north are the monk's gardens and two buildings.  To the east is
the church and the tower of the aedificium.

belltower@nrose.title: Bell Tower
belltower@nrose.description:
You are up in the monastery bell tower.  You see the large bronze
bells up here and the rope to ring them hanging down.  As you
look around you notice that there is absolutely nothing of value
up here.  You also notice that there is no other exit except the
way you came.

libsecretroom3@nrose.title: Library Secret Room
libsecretroom3@nrose.description:
You fall thru a trap door and plunge head first to your untimely
death.  AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

cell1@nrose.title: Cell
cell1@nrose.description:
You have entered a monk's cell.  There is a feather bed along one
wall and a table and chair along the opposite wall.  There is a
door to the east.

library9@nrose.title: Library
library9@nrose.description:
You are in part of the monastery library.  Unfortunately, the
librarian is not very competent and books and scrolls are
stacked everywhere disorienting you.

brunellus@nrose.name: Brunellus
brunellus@nrose.description: Brunellus, the Abbot's horse, is here trying to bite you.

william@nrose.name: William
william@nrose.description: Brother William labors here endlessly in search of the truth.

malachi@nrose.name: Malachi
malachi@nrose.description: Brother Malachi, the librarian, is here gathering books.

remigio@nrose.name: Remigio
remigio@nrose.description: Brother Remigio, the cellarer, is here taking inventory.

abbot@nrose.name: Abbot
abbot@nrose.description: The Abbot says to you, 'Pax Nobiscum.'

whore@nrose.name: Whore
whore@nrose.description: A dirty girl in rags offers you her favors in exchange for food.

beranger@nrose.name: Beranger
beranger@nrose.description: Brother Beranger is here whipping his sinful flesh.

salvatore@nrose.name: Salvatore
salvatore@nrose.description: Brother Salvatore, the hunchback, is here looking for rats to eat.

jorge@nrose.name: Jorge
jorge@nrose.description: Brother Jorge, the blind old monk, guards the forbidden books.

severinus@nrose.name: Severinus
severinus@nrose.description: Brother Severinus, the herbalist, is brewing a potion.

bernardo@nrose.name: Bernardo
bernardo@nrose.description: The inquisitor Bernardo Gui prepares to torture you for entering the library.
